I have never done ITC only EVP

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Gol=
den Phoenix 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, February 15, 20=
09 9:28 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Hey Golden Phoenix


        guess, so =
I used to have a blast with the itcs but after some of the exeriences I hav=
e pretty well avoided doing anymore. we were in a rental house that was not=
 as good place to do ITCs very dark and ominuse activity in that place. man=
y folks know I have been doing this a long long time and not much bothers m=
e anymore. this was 20 years ago and the tapes are still hidden away in a s=
afe place. the house I was born in was the only one more active and freaky,=
 I have ever been in.

        http://www.myspace.com/ghost_hunter50 see my=
 site links

        --- On Sun, 2/15/09, Larry Weinreich <LWEINREICH@satx.=
rr.com> wrote:


          From: Larry Weinreich <LWEINREICH@...>
 =

hoogroups.com

        =
  Seems to be a nice number of people here from Texas :)

            -----=
 Original Message ----- 
            From: Jon 
            To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com 
            Sent: Sunday, February 15, 2009 11:52 AM
       =
     Subject: [EVP-ITC] Hey Golden Phoenix


            GP, I am glad to s=
ee you are here, a friendly face from close by. I am
            also glad =
to see that this site is not all negative. I had just
            joined la=
st week, and made the post about the Door to the Dead; and
            with=
 all the negative post was thinking about leaving this forum. In
          =
  fact I had e-mailed Larry privately expressing that thought.

           =
 I have seen a rash of e-mails more up beat so I have gone back to
        =
    individual e-mails from the digest. I think I will hang around a
      =
      little longer.

            For other members in Texas, I'm in Housto=
n, just across the channel
            from the Golden Phoenix. I see we ar=
e well represented as a state. I
            am glad to meet all of you.

 =
           Regards,
            Jon in Texas

            --- In EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups .com, Golden Phoenix <golden_phoenix42@ ...>
            wrote:

ng around here but

rom: laurie@steuber. com <laurie@steuber. com>

            > I agree, =
Larry! (and I am a psychic, lol)
            > I did not watch the show bec=
ause my group and I were actually out
            investigating  something =
last night. As it is we are very busy with
            cases, box research =
and other research and projects. We do not,
            therefore, have tim=
e to watch other people,often pathetic wanna-be
            famous para-cel=
ebs,  pretend to be what we really are.
            >  
            > I wro=
te a blog about this whole thing - in this field, thos that can
           =
 do..those that can't sit and watch others pretend to do ti on TV.
        =

            > Laurie
            > -----Original Message-----
     =
       > From: "Larry Weinreich" <LWEINREICH@ satx. rr.com>

ent: Saturday, February 14, 2009 1:35pm
            > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com

            >=
 
            > 
            > I find most paranormal shows have become BS =
and I don't watch any.
            Its all the same "dog and pony" act. Sin=
ce "Ghost Hunters" has become
            a hit "everyone" wants their own =
tv show or radio show. Its all "look
            at me".
            >     =
             Sorry I'm very jaded on tv paranormal
            investigator=
s, mediums and evangelists on Sunday mornings. In my book
            they =
all rank just a bit above lawyers but still below pro wrestling.
          =
  >   (Hows that for an introduction?  :)  )
            >                 =
  Larry

            > ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
            > From: John S 
            > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .=
com

Subject: [EVP-ITC] Door To The Dead

            > 
            > 
            > I have to =
admit that I thought I had seen the worst 'paranormal'
            show on =
television already. I was wrong. Door to the Dead has exceeded
            =
my worst expectations.
            >  
            > Generally, I respect J=
ohn Oliver's work as a medium. While I have no
            personal experie=
nce with him, in the past he has looked and acted more
            genuine =
than not, the rolling of the eyes put aside for the moment.
            >  =

            > I do take exception to the characterization of the talking b=
ox as an
            Edison device. I have documented the history of Edison=
, ITC and
            EVP  elsewhere. This is however the smallest concern =
I have with this
            show.
            >  
            > Prior to w=
athcing I had just had a conversation with a respected
            colleagu=
e on the West coast regarding interesting phenomena he and
            othe=
rs are constantly observing in sites with phenomena similar to
            =
that on Door to the Dead. None of those measurements were made by this
    =
        team. The use of thermal in this situation is not indicated as well=
.
            >  
            > The real concern is that no attempt was mad=
e to help this family in
            a broader context. The skeptic did and=
 said nothing skeptical as far
            as I could tell. Key questions w=
ere not asked (at least on-camera)
            that would reveal the psycho=
-dynamics of this family. We know fairly
            well at this time that=
 PK phenomena is often centered on a focal
            person who can exhib=
it specific characteristics. That the team seems
            unaware of thi=
s is quite disturbing to a person like myself.
            >  
            =
> A real research opportunity was lost in this case, as was an
            =
opportunity to educate the public on the right way to approach such
       =
     situations. Continually sending the messages that phenomena is based
 =
           on 'demons' and 'spirits' exclusively does nothing to further th=
e
            position of serious investigators, which is perhaps most trou=
bling of all.
            >
